question: Does simvastatin improve outcomes of aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage?
ideal_answer: No. Simvastatin showed no benefits in decreasing the incidence of vasospasm, DCI, or all-cause mortality after aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage. Patients with aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage should not be treated routinely with simvastatin during the acute stage.
